summary: This bill, the Navajo Nation Rio San José Stream System Water Rights Settlement Act of 2025, aims to settle water rights claims of the Navajo Nation in New Mexico's Rio San José Stream System. It authorizes, ratifies, and confirms an existing agreement, directs the Secretary of the Interior to execute the agreement, and authorizes funds for implementation. It defines terms, outlines the Navajo Nation's water rights, establishes a trust fund, addresses waivers and releases of claims, and provides for judicial review of Navajo Nation Water Use Permit decisions. The bill also includes provisions related to Allottees, expansion of a water supply project, and antideficiency.
